review_title: Good Medical Benefits, No Career Ladders No Innovation
job_title: Anonymous in Costa Mesa, CA
pros: The best things about Orange Coast College is their medical benefits for employees for example CalPERS. There are many new buildings, and it is fun to be around students, nice campus HR people, and there is a lot of focus around training and employees.
cons: people do not work as hard or are as innovative as it would be in a private company because consequences are minimal to none. If you like to problem solve or go above and beyond, it wont be rewarded. No upward mobility or career ladders. If you don't get restless about the status quo and enjoy cruising at work, then this place is for you.

job_title: Tutor in Costa Mesa, CA
pros: it is a good place for starting
cons: I do not see any negative points

job_title: Professor in Orange, CA
pros: It is very Rewarding to work there.

job_title: Student Assistant in Orange, CA

job_title: Manager in Orange, CA
pros: ok to work at. great benefits
cons: needs better leadership. very unstructured

job_title: Peer Tutor in Costa Mesa, CA
pros: I loved my time with my students. I had a lot of freedom to find my own tutoring style and discover what was most effective for me.
cons: I wish there were more extensive training, better pay, and more upward mobility.

review_title: College looks after faculty, but not all employees
job_title: Division Coordinator in Costa Mesa, CA
pros: Great vacation and sick leave
cons: College looks after faculty, but not classified employees. Was asked to do far above and beyond my job description for no extra pay or even recognition. Some employees are given exceptional treatment and are able to break the contract and other office practices, but other employees are chastised and punished for doing things that are in their job description. Extremely political and at times toxic work environments.

review_title: Generally a good place to work, but watch out for politics
job_title: Instructor in Irvine, CA
pros: There are many good students here, earnestly trying to learn and advance in life.
cons: Management is typically pursuing their own goals, not necessarily trying to support the faculty or students.

review_title: I'm just trying to access Glassdoor...

job_title: Barista in Costa Mesa, CA

job_title: Clerk in Costa Mesa, CA
pros: Working in an institution of learning is very rewarding.  Staff are all very helpful and kind.  This school is highly fiscally responsible... especially in light of current state budget issues.  A great environment for the most part.  There are fighting factions and unions, but those issues are few and minor.
cons: Limited to 150 days per year.  There is a hiring freeze so unlikely to turn into a full time position.  Also - Public Service has its own issues and the CA budget is going to ultimately make things worse.  Divisions do not get along so it is a challenge also.  But these things are not unique to this particular institution.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Costa Mesa, CA
pros: Very low stress. People are very down to Earth, and people are extremely open about their worldviews. District IT staff is amazing!
cons: No benefits for doing exceptional work. No motivation to due above and beyond. And when you do it might ruffle a couple of coworkers. People are afraid to take chances that might better assist the organization or can assist students.

job_title: Student Assistant in Costa Mesa, CA
pros:
I worked as a student assistant at the Success Center tutoring math levels from College Algebra to Multi-variable Calculus. Some Pros are:

- Getting help from more experienced tutors helped me on my classes
- Getting to know other students
- An hourly bump after Tutoring class is completed.
- Schedule is flexible with my college classes
- My coordinator (Debbie Raskin) was great!
cons: - Since OCC has cut down on budget, the Tutoring center now closes at 7pm. That means that students that are taking a high load of classes in the morning and evenings might find it difficult to schedule desired weekly hours. I used to have some days work from 7 to 9:30. It was great!

review_title: Awesome Place to Work (Wait till budget improves to apply)
job_title: in Costa Mesa, CA
pros:
1. Awesome culture, best I have ever experienced
2. No turnover at all, people love it here
3. Great location, working on a college campus is fun
4. Co- workers turned out to be lifelong friends.
5. They will pay 3300 per year towards your degree
6. Co workers are generally very happy to be here
cons:
CA budget issues- serious layoff likely in 2011.
It seems hard to move up into management

job_title: Part Time Faculty in Costa Mesa, CA
pros: Orange Coast College is one of the leading educational institutions in technology innovation with smart classrooms.  It is formed by a rich classroom and world cultures.   It strives to prepare and train students for the work market by providing curriculum that is relevant to the demands of our current industry.  OCC brings professionals to work together as a family for the benefit of our studnets and community.
cons: There are not really benefits for part time faculty.

job_title: Cashier in Costa Mesa, CA
pros: easy job.  The pay was typical of minimum wage but for the work you do, who can complain.  I like the hours
cons: They didnt give me enough hours.  I wanted to work more but there was just so many people because it was a seasonal job

review_title: Pleasant and enjoyable place to work.
job_title: in Costa Mesa, CA
pros: Everyone is very friendly and helpful. The campus is beautiful and its location right next to the beach is very nice. There is also plenty of parking, as the fair grounds are right across the street if additional parking is needed.
cons: Most people are there in transition so they are not there for very long. Also it is difficult to make appointments with senior management.

pros:
-Flexible Scheduling (student's classes are accommodated)
-Relaxed Work Environment (talkative coworkers)

-Transit (on campus)
cons:
-Not a lot of hours (budget cuts?)
